name: Mark Barker
title: Co-founder / strategy lead
shortBio: Mark is a data-driven marketer with deep experience in integrated media strategy and social impact advertising. Prior to founding Craft & Commerce, Mark was General Manager of GOOD’s digital platform and GOOD/Corps agency business, where he crafted innovative, content-based consumer engagements for the likes of Gates Foundation, Google and Starbucks.
fullBio: Mark is a data-driven marketer with deep experience in integrated media strategy and social impact advertising. Prior to founding Craft & Commerce, Mark was General Manager of GOOD’s digital platform and GOOD/Corps agency business, where he crafted innovative, content-based consumer engagements for the likes of Gates Foundation, Google and Starbucks. Working within high-growth corporate divisions such as MTV Networks’ cross-property Generator unit and McCann Erickson’s TAG young adult marketing speciality--and as an independent consultant--Mark has driven measurable, meaningful business and social impact outcomes for leading startups, brands, and non-profit organizations, including Nativo, Verizon, and the NFL. Mark holds an MBA from the Acton School of Business, and a BA from Washington & Lee University. Mark is a frequent author and speaker at the intersection of purpose and performance, and serves as an advisor to several startups and community-based non-profits.

name: Jordan Ruden
title: Co-founder / campaign lead
shortBio: Jordan is a leading creative and technology specialist with a track record of empowering nonprofits, advocacy organizations, and purpose-driven brands to effectively harness paid media, cut through today’s noisy attention landscape, and drive real-world outcomes.
fullBio: Jordan is a leading creative and technology specialist with a track record of empowering nonprofits, advocacy organizations, and purpose-driven brands to effectively harness paid media, cut through today’s noisy attention landscape, and drive real-world outcomes. Jordan has designed and executed groundbreaking, award-winning advertising campaigns that have helped Girl Scouts of the USA transform its membership funnel, San Francisco MTA achieve record reductions in traffic fatalities, LA’s Measure H and California’s 3P’s realize landmark legislative victories, and Bright Pink inspire over 2MM women to assess their cancer risk. Prior to founding Craft & Commerce, Jordan served as a key figure at startups including GOOD, Yahoo!, and Vault--blending strategy, analytics, storytelling, and operational rigor to scale business unit growth. Jordan holds a BFA from Ithaca College, served on NYC’s Committee for Urban Entrepreneurship, and is a sought-after trainer and speaker on digital trends and best practices.

name: Ella Evans
title: Copywriter
shortBio: Ella is a savvy, leading-edge digital communicator who oversees content strategy and copywriting for Craft & Commerce’s campaigns.
fullBio: Ella is a savvy, leading-edge digital communicator who oversees content strategy and copywriting for Craft & Commerce’s campaigns. A veteran of startups and the pioneering digital agency VaynerMedia, Ella’s early career coincided with the explosion of social media marketing, instilling in her an intuitive strategic and creative expertise in today’s most powerful marketing platforms. Ella brings her deep knowledge of copywriting best practices, content and ad strategy, branding and social voice development, and platform optimizations to sharpen and supercharge every campaign.

name: Emily Iles
title: Creative Director
shortBio: Emily establishes the creative strategy for Craft & Commerce’s campaigns, aligning her depth of experience and keen eye for breakthrough design with the objectives and requirements of any given project, yielding effective, “feed-stopping” creative that truly defines a campaign.
fullBio: Emily establishes the creative strategy for Craft & Commerce’s campaigns, aligning her depth of experience and keen eye for breakthrough design with the objectives and requirements of any given project, yielding effective, “feed-stopping” creative that truly defines a campaign. Prior to joining Craft & Commerce, Emily was an art director at Almanac in St. Louis, where she worked with non-profit, education, civic and local business clients, specializing in branding, print and digital design, and UX. Emily shepherds creative from the initial brief, to asset production, and through rigorous testing and optimization.

name: Karen Stransky-Price
title: Director of Operations
shortBio: Karen leads day-to-day campaign management for our partners, stewarding campaign setup and delivery, iteration and optimization, and reporting--as well as generally keeps the trains running on time.
fullBio: Karen leads day-to-day campaign management for our partners, stewarding campaign setup and delivery, iteration and optimization, and reporting--as well as generally keeps the trains running on time. Prior to working with Craft & Commerce, Karen specialized in analytics, site management, product design and project management for leading ecommerce and sustainability companies such as West Elm, One Kings Lane and TerraCycle.

name: Kellie Chea
title: Account Director
shortBio: Kellie channels her background in project management and communications to amplify the voices of progressive social organizations and nonprofits.
fullBio: Kellie channels her background in project management and communications to amplify the voices of progressive social organizations and nonprofits. Before Craft & Commerce, Kellie worked as a production coordinator at Hook, managing digital marketing campaigns for Google consumer apps, and provided administrative support to the Head of Brand Marketing at Google. Kellie provides day-to-day campaign management by implementing, executing, and reporting on campaigns to deliver effective reach and impact in the digital space.

name: Jacob Lepiarz
title: Account Director
shortBio: Jacob is a seasoned movement building and cause marketing strategist with deep digital and integrated marketing expertise.
fullBio: Jacob is a seasoned movement building and cause marketing strategist with deep digital and integrated marketing expertise. Jacob has developed and executed dozens of successful marketing campaigns for global non-profits, advocacy organizations and private companies.  During his time at Craft & Commerce, he has led hyper-targeted advocacy campaigns for high-profile, statewide legislative efforts, conducted in-depth audience insights research for global foundations, and done digital capacity building work across a range of clients. Prior to joining Craft & Commerce, Jacob managed global cause marketing efforts for Johnson & Johnson, including management of the Donate a Photo app where he successfully built a movement of over 250,000 people in 4 countries who unlocked over $2.5MM for partner non-profits. Jacob has also worked as adjunct professor at Rutgers University, teaching the Service, Leadership, Impact course.
